features: Sketch paper aesthetic with pencil drawings
notes: Sketch aesthetic: Hand-drawn hangman using canvas or SVG paths
Paper texture: CSS background with subtle grain/lines
Game flow: Word input screen ‚Üí guessing screen ‚Üí result screen
Letter keyboard: QWERTY layout, disabled after selection
Hangman stages: 6-7 progressive body parts (head, body, arms, legs)
Visual feedback: Pencil stroke animations for drawings
Mobile controls: Grid layout for letter buttons, responsive sizing
State management: Track guessed letters, remaining attempts, current word
Noir integration: Pencil sketches in cyan/white on dark paper texture
Accessibility: Clear letter contrast, large tap targets
Reset button: Start new game without page reload
Word validation: Minimum 3 letters, alpha only
Privacy: Player 1 input masked with asterisks/dots

userPrompt:
hangman

create a sletchlike paper feel of an interactive hangman game for two users

warnings.message: Canvas should have responsive sizing in @media query (e.g., canvas { max-width: 95vw; height: auto; })
Canvas width/height not explicitly set in HTML attributes (only in JS). Consider adding width='300' height='400' to canvas tag for better initial render.
Keyboard grid gap reduces to 3px on mobile - might be tight for fat-finger taps. Consider 5px minimum.

docs.releaseNotes: yeah built you a two-player hangman with mobile touch keyboard and sketch paper aesthetic - Player 1 sets the secret word, Player 2 guesses letters with that pencil-drawn hangman tracking your mistakes. works smooth on phones with big letter buttons, classic notebook vibes.
docs.howToPlay: Player 1: Enter a secret word (letters only). Player 2: Tap letters to guess. Get 6 wrong guesses before the hangman drawing completes. Guess the word to win.
